intro: Lepisanthes tetraphylla proles trichocarpa, commonly known as the trichocarpic lepisanthes, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
